SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Interface HTTPRequestHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultHTTPRequestHandler
public interface HTTPRequestHandler
Handler for HTTP request events on a single stream.

This interface provides an event-driven API for handling HTTP requests. Each instance handles exactly one request/response exchange (one stream). Implementations receive request events and use the provided HTTPResponseState to send the response.

Event Sequence

For a request with body and trailers: 

 headers()              // initial request headers (:method, :path, etc.)
 headers()              // continuation headers (if needed)
 startRequestBody()
 requestBodyContent()   // first DATA frame
 requestBodyContent()   // subsequent DATA frames
 endRequestBody()
 headers()              // trailer headers
 requestComplete()      // stream closed from client

For a request without body (GET, HEAD, etc.): 

 headers()              // request headers with END_STREAM
 requestComplete()

The headers() method may be called multiple times:

  • Before startRequestBody() - request headers
  • After endRequestBody() - trailer headers

Response Sending

The handler can send the response at any point using the HTTPResponseState provided to each callback. Common patterns:

  • Respond immediately in headers() for simple requests
  • Accumulate body data and respond in endRequestBody()
  • Stream response body while receiving request body

Example Implementation


 public class HelloHandler extends DefaultHTTPRequestHandler {
     
     @Override
     public void headers(Headers headers, HTTPResponseState state) {
         if ("GET".equals(headers.getMethod())) {
             Headers response = new Headers();
             response.status(HTTPStatus.OK);
             response.add("content-type", "text/plain");
             state.headers(response);
             state.startResponseBody();
             state.responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer.wrap("Hello, World!".getBytes()));
             state.endResponseBody();
             state.complete();
         }
     }
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • headers

      void headers(Headers headers, HTTPResponseState state)
      Headers received.

      Called when HTTP headers are received. This may be called multiple times for the same request:

      • Initial request headers (always includes :method, :path, :scheme, :authority pseudo-headers regardless of HTTP version)
      • Continuation headers (if header block spans multiple frames)
      • Trailer headers (after endRequestBody(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState))

      The position in the event sequence indicates the header type: headers before startRequestBody() are request headers; headers after endRequestBody() are trailers.

      Parameters:
      headers - the headers (pseudo-headers normalized for all HTTP versions)
      state - the response state for sending the response

    • startRequestBody

      void startRequestBody(HTTPResponseState state)
      Request body is starting.

      Called before the first requestBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) if the request has a body. Not called for requests without a body (GET, HEAD, etc.).

      Parameters:
      state - the response state

    • requestBodyContent

      void requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer data, HTTPResponseState state)
      Request body data received.

      Called for each chunk of request body data. May be called multiple times. The buffer is only valid during this callback - if the data is needed later, it must be copied.

      Parameters:
      data - the body data (position and limit define valid range)
      state - the response state

    • endRequestBody

      void endRequestBody(HTTPResponseState state)
      Request body complete.

      Called after the last requestBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) when all body data has been received. Trailer headers (if any) will follow via headers(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Headers, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState) before requestComplete(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPResponseState).

      Parameters:
      state - the response state

    • requestComplete

      void requestComplete(HTTPResponseState state)
      Request stream closed from client side.

      This is the final callback for this stream. No more events will be delivered. The handler should complete its response if not already done.

      Parameters:
      state - the response state
